content: I’ve always made more than my husband, so when I got pregnant with our first kid we decided he would stay home. People are definitely surprised when they hear he is a stay-at-home dad, but honestly it’s made it a lot easier for me to focus on succeeding at work, and I doubt I would have continued to move up as quickly as I did after kids if we didn’t have this set up. We made the decision together to prioritize my career, since he’s never really been the ambitious type. We definitely have had our disagreements about household chores and things like that, but over the years things have balanced out and it works well.
